data.title: The Saving of Appearances: Denys Arcand's Jesus of Montreal
data.meta_description: 773-2242-1-SM - Free download as PDF File (.pdf), Text File (.txt) or read online for free. This document provides a summary and analysis of Denys Arcand's film Jesus of Montreal. It discusses how the film consists of an overlaying of three narratives: 1) the story of a group of actors attempting an interpretation of Jesus' life, 2) their interpretation through a passion play, and 3) the original Jesus narrative that viewers are familiar with. It analyzes how the film blurs boundaries between these narratives in a postmodern way. It also compares Arcand's postmodern approach to a modern interpretation like Fellini's. Finally, it explores the film's use of analogies between the lead actor and Jesus to reconstruct the original Jesus narrative in a new way.
